title: The Darkness on fighting Liam Gallagher, their 'superhero Jesus' album, and why hipsters are ruining rock ’n’ roll
text:
Sitting in their record company’s West London HQ, The Darkness listen as I reel off a list of bands who broke through at the same time as them in 2003. The Datsuns, Hot Hot Heat, The Cooper Temple Clause. All of them, to borrow a line from Spinal Tap, are currently residing in the “Where are they now?” file. So just why do The Darkness – purveyors of over-the-top heavy metal, all screeching falsetto vocals and crunching power chords – think they have survived? It may surprise music fans to know that next week’s new album, Easter is Cancelled, will be their sixth.

“It would have suited people for us to be a flash in the pan,” says singer Justin Hawkins, at 44 still every inch the rock star he...
description: Sitting in their record company’s West London HQ, The Darkness listen as I reel off a list of bands who broke through at the same time as them in 2003.
